metadata.Title: CVE-2021-44718 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
wolfSSL through 5.0.0 allows an attacker to cause a denial of service and infinite loop in the client component by sending crafted traffic from a Machine-in-the-Middle (MITM) position. The root cause is that the client module accepts TLS messages that normally are only sent to TLS servers.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-44718` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwolfssl32 - 5.2.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.2.0-2').
